author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 'School of Rock - the Musical' headed to schools
text:
Alex Brightman, star "School of Rock" “School of Rock — the Musical” hasn’t even opened yet, but students already have the chance to perform the show in their auditoriums and theater.
On Monday, composer Andre Lloyd Webber, working in concert with the licensing company R&H Theatricals, announced that they’re granting rights for U.S. and Canadian youth productions. of the show based on the 2003 Jack Black movie.
Anthony Harvey/Getty Images Andrew Lloyd Webber poses during a photocall for "Cats" in London in 2014
“This musical is entirely about empowering kids to rock out, so what better way to herald its arrival and celebrate its themes than to allow youth performances from coast-to-coast,” Lloyd Webber said in a statement. “This will allow young fans to engage with the material in a much deeper way, and we think will only heighten enthusiasm for our Broadway premiere.”
Based on the 2003 Jack Black movie, “School of Rock — the Musical” stars Alex Brightman as a wannabe rocker who’s kicked out of his band and becomes a surprise source of inspiration as a substitute teacher. The show by by Lloyd Webber, lyricist Glenn Slater and writer Julian Fellowes is set to begin previews at the Winter Garden Theater on Nov. 9 and open Dec. 6.
Applications for “School of Rock - The Musical” will be accepted immediately at www.rnh.com. Materials will ship to interested performance groups shortly after opening night, in January 2016.
